alert.note: Alert for Cochise (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 12 at 4:06PM MST until September 12 at 6:30PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Cochise County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 630 PM MST. * At 406 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing between 1 and 2 inches of heavy rain between the Dragoon Mountains and the Willcox Playa. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Dragoon, Pearce-Sunsites, Cochise and Kansas Settlement. This includes the following streams and drainages... Willow Wash, Haberstock Wash, Dragoon Wash, Walnut Wash, Slavin Wash and Clifford Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
